resourceProfile.confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this resource profile?
resourceProfile.label.name: Name
resourceProfile.tip.priority: Lower numbers indicate higher priority. Higher priority profiles are matched first. When multiple profiles match a resource, the one with highest priority takes effect.
resourceProfile.tip.name: A unique name to identify this profile.
resourceProfile.tip.searchCriteria: Define which resources this profile applies to. Resources matching these criteria will use this profile's settings.
resourceProfile.tip.nameTemplate: Customize how resource names are displayed using property placeholders like {Name}. Leave empty to use the original filename.
resourceProfile.tip.playableFiles: Rules to identify which files within a resource are playable. Configure by file extension or filename pattern.
resourceProfile.tip.players: External applications to open playable files. You can assign different players for different file extensions. By default, the system's default application is used to open playable files.
resourceProfile.tip.properties: Select which properties should be displayed or editable for resources matching this profile.
resourceProfileGuide.welcome.title: Welcome to Resource Profiles
resourceProfileGuide.welcome.description: Resource profiles help you customize how different types of resources are displayed, matched, and played. Let's get started!
resourceProfileGuide.matching.title: Search Criteria & Priority
resourceProfileGuide.matching.subtitle: Control which resources each profile applies to
resourceProfileGuide.matching.point1: Define search criteria to automatically match resources based on their properties
resourceProfileGuide.matching.point2: Set priority to determine which profile takes effect when multiple profiles match
resourceProfileGuide.display.title: Display & Enhancers
resourceProfileGuide.display.subtitle: Customize how resources are presented
resourceProfileGuide.display.point1: Create custom name templates using property placeholders
resourceProfileGuide.display.point2: Configure enhancers to automatically enrich resource metadata
resourceProfileGuide.display.point3: Select which properties to display for each profile
resourceProfileGuide.playback.title: Playback Configuration
resourceProfileGuide.playback.subtitle: Set up how files are opened and played
resourceProfileGuide.playback.point1: Define which file extensions are considered playable
resourceProfileGuide.playback.point2: Configure external players for different file types
resourceProfileGuide.binding.title: Property Binding
resourceProfileGuide.binding.subtitle: Bind different property values to different profiles
resourceProfileGuide.binding.point1: Bind specific property values to profiles for better organization
resourceProfileGuide.binding.point2: Bound properties are prioritized and displayed prominently in resource details
resourceProfile.tip.deleteEnhancementsFo: Delete enhancements for resources matching profile
resourceProfile.tip.noEnhancersConfigure: This profile has no enhancers configured. All enhancements for matching resources will be deleted.
resourceProfile.tip.deleteEmptyRecordsOn: Only delete enhancement records that have no actual enhancement data
resourceProfile.tip.commandTemplatePlace: Use {0} as placeholder for the file path. Example: --fullscreen {0}
resourceProfile.tip.playerExtensionUsage: This player will be used for files with these extensions
resourceProfile.tip.enterFilePathPreview: Enter a file path to preview the command
resourceProfile.tip.testPathIsFolder: Note: The test path is a folder, not a file
resourceProfile.empty.noPlayersConfigure: No players configured. Click 'Add Player' to get started.
resourceProfile.empty.noResourcesMatched: No resources matched by this criteria
resourceProfile.error.selectFileNotFolde: Please select a file, not a folder
resourceProfile.error.fillAllExecutableP: Please fill in all executable paths before saving.
resourceProfile.warning.cannotBeUndone: Warning: This action cannot be undone.
resourceProfile.tip.filesWithExtensionsP: Files with these extensions will be considered playable
resourceProfile.tip.regexPatternPlayable: Regex pattern to match playable file names (optional, leave empty for extension-only matching)
resourceProfile.tip.otherSettingsAfterCr: Other settings can be configured directly in the table after creation.
resourceProfile.modal.editDisplayNameTem: Edit display name template for resources
resourceProfile.tip.wrappersRemovedAutom: Wrappers around empty property values will be removed automatically.
resourceProfile.input.templatePlaceholde: Enter template or click properties above to insert...
resourceProfile.tip.leaveEmptyForFilenam: Leave empty to use filename as display name.
enhancementConfig.title: Enhancement Property Configuration
enhancementConfig.selectGroupFirst: Please select at least one resource type first
enhancementConfig.dynamicHint: {{enhancers}} in this group support dynamic properties. Click the configure button below to add more properties.
enhancementConfig.dynamicExplanation: Dynamic properties are extracted at runtime by enhancers from their data sources, such as properties in the left panel of Bangumi pages, properties on the right side of DLsite covers, and regex capture groups. You need to configure the corresponding enhancer first. Once configured, dynamic properties will appear in the list below.
enhancementConfig.configureDynamicEnhanc: Configure enhancers that support dynamic properties
enhancementConfig.noDynamicPropertiesYet: No dynamic properties configured yet. Please configure the enhancers above first.
resourceProfile.propertyPool.title: Property Pool Configuration
resourceProfile.propertyPool.description: Configure which properties should be displayed for resources matching this profile, and the value display priority for each property.
resourceProfile.propertyPool.empty: No properties added. Click 'Add Property' to get started.
resourceProfile.scopePriority.customizeT: Customize value display priority for this property, overriding the global setting
